function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential privacy and security risks associated with monitoring and tracking of infected individuals' data through IoT","Impact":"Risk of unauthorized access to sensitive health data and potential misuse of personal information","Mitigation":"Encryption of data, stringent access control measures, and compliance with data protection regulations","Technologies":"Data encryption, secure network protocols, and biometric authentication","People":"Infected individuals, healthcare workers, and general public","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, government agencies, IoT solution providers"},{"Description":"Reliance on IoT for monitoring critical health data could lead to data inaccuracies and errors","Impact":"Misdiagnosis, incorrect treatment, and compromised patient safety","Mitigation":"Regular calibration and validation of IoT devices, manual verification of critical health parameters, and training for healthcare personnel on interpreting IoT data","Technologies":"Calibration tools, validation protocols, and training modules for healthcare professionals","People":"Healthcare workers, patients, and caregivers","Owner":"Medical institutions, healthcare providers, IoT device manufacturers"},{"Description":"Overreliance on IoT technology may lead to neglect of essential non-technological intervention measures","Impact":"Decreased emphasis on traditional public health measures, leading to potential spread of the virus","Mitigation":"Balanced approach integrating IoT with traditional public health strategies, education on the limitations of IoT, and reinforcement of non-technological preventive measures","Technologies":"Health education platforms, communication tools, and community engagement initiatives","People":"Public health authorities, policymakers, and the general public","Owner":"Government agencies, public health organizations, and community leaders"}]}
